intro: Ranunculus vestergrenii, commonly known as the Vestergrén's buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically has palmately divided leaves and produces yellow or white flowers with numerous stamens. It thrives in alpine environments and is adapted to cold climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
